definitions: To turn or twist (something, especially a handle or key) to operate a mechanism.
To move in a twisting or spiral course.
To wrap or coil (something) around itself or another object.
To make (a musical instrument) produce a sound by blowing into it.
To hoist or raise with a winch or similar device.
examples: She had to wind the clock every day.
The river winds through the valley.
He began to wind the yarn into a ball.
The hunter would wind his horn.
They used a crane to wind the beam into place.
